title: "It's just a Game..." why this phrase is better than anything else.
body: Because once you understand that league is just a game, you stop raging, telling people to kill themselves for doing bad, and start to enjoy this game.

The two messages every League player should know. This comment and "It's just a game". For normals and ranked.
"Its just a game" is reserved for Aram and Normals. There is a reason Ranked is competitive

> "Its just a game" is reserved for Aram and Normals. There is a reason Ranked is competitive

But there's no reason to take an aspect of a game that seriously. You aren't in LCS. You aren't getting paid. You aren't having real life issues decided by your elo. It's just a game.

> > "Its just a game" is reserved for Aram and Normals. There is a reason Ranked is competitive
> 
> But there's no reason to take an aspect of a game that seriously. You aren't in LCS. You aren't getting paid. You aren't having real life issues decided by your elo. It's just a game.

The problem is that you are trivializing something that someone else finds important to them. Nobody has the right to tell someone what to value and what not to value in life.

People can place disproportionate amounts of value into things that seemingly have no real value to others... Just how you can say money is "just paper" or the bible is "just a book" or whatever...

Being a decent human being is also accepting that other people might place more value over certain things than you do... and to at least give those people an ounce of understanding or at the very least, don't trivialize what they find important.

This is true because you never know what is happening in the other person's life. They could be having REAL issues and the only way they have found an escape is within SR. Granted, League is a game, but it's more about the person's perceptive that's playing it. To some, it could be the only way they get recognized.
You could use that exact same logic for people who play for fun and "relaxation"

"It's just X" can be said to anything to the point where it's ridiculous.
It's the value we put into things that makes the matter, not the things themselves.
We're all currently looking into a chunk of plastic and hitting it with our fingers.
It's just a damn computer, yet most people would get upset if somebody trashed it for you.

Except ~90% of all money in the world is stored virtually, only ~10% is hard cash.
So no, the money isn't real, only the value of it is.
Same thing goes for a bill, it's a sheet of paper.

Only reason you can do anything with that money is because other people have subscribed to the same system and uses it as a form of proof of a transaction of things and services that are of value to others, value which pretty much always requires time and effort to create or obtain.
Which is exactly what a lot of people invest in competetive video games.

You can say "it's just a game!" but it's no less ignorant than "it's just money!".
Yes, neither is the end of the world, but that's the case with most things we get upset over.
